Tom and Jerry! — Team Report from the 2023 Tainan Regional Champion
Nico
December 28, 2022
Hello, everyone! My name is
Tseng
Yan-rong
, and you can also call me by my IGN
Tony
.
I started playing VGC in
Pokémon Sword
&
Pokémon Shield
, and after a couple of top cuts this is my best result: I am very happy to be the
champion
of
Pokémon Scarlet
&
Pokémon Violet
Tainan Regionals
!
Table of Contents
Teambuilding process
This was the
first competition in
Pokémon Scarlet
&
Pokémon Violet
, and the mainstream Pokémon in Ranked Battles are a few. A player must have countermeasures and cognition about these mainstream Pokémon. Let me talk about my thoughts below.
First of all, I think that, in this environment, a high-speed combination was needed. So I needed Tailwind Pokémon and Trick Room Pokémon. For the Trick Room mode, I used the
brother-sister
combination of
Armarouge
and
Female Indeedee
, which is very popular now. The Tailwind responsible is
Murkrow
.
The next slots went to the new Pokémon
Meowscarada
and
Maushold
. I personally love Maushold and I think both are very strong and had to join the team.
The last to join the team was
Hydreigon
. I think Draco Meteor, paired with Murkrow’s Haze to clear the negative effects, is very powerful. Hydreigon… I Choose You!
So why not using
Gholdengo
? The move Make It Rain is very powerful and one you can use almost anytime… But actually, there was no reason. I just like Hydreigon more than Gholdengo!
The Team
Get the team’s paste
here
!
Indeedee
(F) @ Psychic Seed
Ability: Psychic Surge
Level: 50
Tera Type:
Psychic
EVs: 244 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 4 Spe
Bold Nature
– Follow Me
– Dazzling Gleam
– Helping Hand
– Protect
Indeedee
‘s
Defense
is maxed, and
HP
is trained to 16
n
. The remaining EVs can be allocated to HP, Speed, and Special Attack. Carrying
Psychic Seed
plus a great Special Defense can block Hydreigon holding Choice Specs and using Dark Pulse. In general, I think the main bulk is very adequate!
Armarouge
@ Life Orb
Ability: Flash Fire
Level: 50
Tera Type:
Grass
EVs: 228 HP / 20 Def / 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 4 Spe
Modest Nature
IVs: 0 Atk
– Expanding Force
– Armor Cannon
– Trick Room
– Protect
As one of the attackers, the reason why
Armarouge
‘s
Speed
EVs are not zero is that my team has both the fast (Tailwind) and the slow (Trick Room) modes. I hoped it to be faster than Jolly Meowscarada in Tailwind.
The
HP
is adjusted to a value of 189 (which is the greatest value that is 10
n
−1), with
Life Orb
to maximize the benefit of HP loss. Armarouge is currently the only Pokémon who can learn
Expanding Force
by itself to take advantage of Indeedee’s Psychic Surge-induced Psychic Terrain. The damage is really strong!
Maushold
@ Wide Lens
Ability: Technician
Level: 50
Tera Type:
Ghost
EVs: 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe
Jolly Nature
– Population Bomb
– Encore
– Follow Me
– Protect
Maushold
is my hero! The move
Population Bomb
is really strong. Combined with
Wide Lens
and my belief in Maushold, I can hit 10 times with confidence. There are also support move slots for
Follow Me
and
Encore
.
Maushold can also play an excellent supporting role. It acts as a mixed support/offensive piece in my team.
Hydreigon
@ Choice Specs
Ability: Levitate
Level: 50
Tera Type:
Steel
EVs: 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe
Timid Nature
IVs: 0 Atk
– Draco Meteor
– Heat Wave
– Dark Pulse
– Flash Cannon
Hydreigon
is the team’s second attacker. The damage of
Choice Specs
-boosted moves really makes people like it.
Hydreigon Terastallizes frequently, and its
Steel
Tera Type can help it resist Fairy- and Dragon-type damage. Use
Draco Meteor
alongside Murkrow’s Tailwind, and in the next turn, use Haze to eliminate the negative stat changes and continue to use Draco Meteor to attack mercilessly. The damage of Draco Meteor with Choice Specs is really high, I really like this combination!
Meowscarada
@ Focus Sash
Ability: Overgrow
Level: 50
Tera Type:
Grass
EVs: 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe
Adamant Nature
– Flower Trick
– Knock Off
– Protect
– Trick Room
I think both of
Meowscarada
‘s Abilities,
Overgrow
and
Protean
, are very strong. The Ability I chose this time is Overgrow with
Focus Sash
, which can help the ability to work and then boost
Flower Trick
to deal considerable damage.
It also has
Trick Room
, which is mainly used to counter Pokémon who use Tailwind. In the closed team list format we used in
Tainan
, it could catch the opponent off guard to set up Trick Room, and I then could gain the Speed advantage again.
Murkrow
@ Eviolite
Ability: Prankster
Level: 50
Tera Type:
Dark
EVs: 252 HP / 4 Atk / 140 Def / 108 SpD / 4 Spe
Impish Nature
– Taunt
– Haze
– Tailwind
– Foul Play
Murkrow
is excellent for the supporting role. It can use
Tailwind
to control speed, and also has other excellent status moves, such as
Taunt
,
Quash
,
Haze
… Haze’s main use is to contain the combination of Dondozo and Tatsugiri.
Basically every player’s team has Murkrow, so I would choose
Trick Room
and control the speed. Murkrow would not be used unless facing the combination of Dondozo and Tatsugiri.
How to use the team
Lead
Back
+
,
I like to start with
Meowscarada
+
Maushold
. These two act as high-speed attackers in my team. When facing a Pokémon that uses Tailwind, Maushold can use Protect and Meowscarada can use Trick Room. I save
Armarouge
and
Indeedee
in the back to attack.
I almost started every
Tainan
round like this every game, and it
helped me win
the tournament!
Tournament run
Unfortunately, I did not take notes during the tournament so I can’t remember which teams I faced throughout the tournament. This was my run at
Tainan Regionals
‘ top cut!
Top cut
Round
Result
Opponent
Opponent’s team
Top 16
Win
Mak Kwan Ho
(
KanadeVgc
)
Top 8
Win
Lin Kun-wu
(
假面・德・C
)
Top 4
Win
Tseng Yi-kai
(赫蘿)
Finals
WW
Ku Chao-chen
(
FM寶可夢子
)
You can watch my
finals match
against Chao-chen (starting at 9:00:00) below!
Conclusions
I am really
happy
and I feel
lucky
to win the Championship this time! I could use two of my favourite new Pokémon, Maushold and Armarouge, at the same time, and Maushold can attack 10 times per turn.
I look forward to the next tournaments where I can continue to use
my favourite Pokémon
and get good results for me!
I am very happy to
share
the information of this competition with you. I hope to have the opportunity to
communicate
more with players who love Pokémon in the future! Since I don’t have a Twitter account, you can find me on Discord as
Tony0912
#7648
.
This is
my team
, feel welcome to use it for reference!

Stream details and caster lineup for Bologna Special Event have been announced!
The last event of the season in Europe is streamed on 1–2 June, with Charlie Merriman, Jamie Boyt, Lee Provost and Markus Stadter as casters.
Alberto Núñez
28 May, 2024
David Rodríguez is the 2024 Mexico City Special Event Champion!
2024 LAIC semifinalist David Rodríguez has won his fourth Special Event title! He defeated Mexican Rin Leiba in the finals of the Mexico City Special Event, in the first event in that country in over 5 years!
Alberto Núñez
27 May, 2024
Teams, results and all info from the 2024 Los Angeles Regional!
American Montana Mott has won his first Regional title! He defeated 2023 Hartford Regional finalist Ryan Haig in the finals of the Los Angeles Regional, giving Shadow Rider Calyrex its first win in this ruleset!
Alberto Núñez
27 May, 2024

Give up Garchomp! — Team Report from the Runner-up of the 2023 Tainan Regionals
Victory Road
December 24, 2022
Hello, everyone! I am
Ku Chao-chen
, or
GoogleTWN
and I’m glad to share the team I used to get to the finals of
Tainan Regionals
and what I was thinking about the team!
Table of Contents
Teambuilding process
I started testing the Ranked Battles for a week before a friend of mine sent me
this Rental Team
by
Joji Kaieda
(
Suica
).
In the testing process, I came to think that
Murkrow
,
Gholdengo
and
Hydreigon
gave me a good feel, but when I used
Garchomp
I lost a lot of games. I felt Garchomp can’t get one-hit knockouts, will be OHKO’d instead very easily, and can’t move faster than the opponent. About
Arcanine
and
Breloom
, I seldom chose them while I was testing this team.
After a few days, I asked my friend
Chen Chih-chun
(
ToooTz
) about a new team, and he showed me
Markus Stadter
‘s
Stuttgart
-winning
Rental Team
, which featured
Annihilape
. How wise of a Pokémon choice! I’ll explain better in the next section.
After a lot of thinking, I found my answer to replace Garchomp in
Federico Camporesi
‘s LimitlessVGC tournament-winning
Rental Team
:
Dragonite
!
Finally, the sixth spot of the team went to
Armarouge
, which helped as a counter to Trick Room-oriented Torkoal teams.
After this thought process, I finally had the
final configuration
of the team!
The Team
Get the original version of the team’s paste
here
!
Get the latest, improved version of the team’s paste
here
!
Murkrow
(F) @ Eviolite
Ability: Prankster
Level: 50
Tera Type:
Ghost
EVs: 236 HP / 156 Def / 116 SpD
Timid Nature
IVs: 0 Atk
– Foul Play
– Tailwind
– Haze
– Quash
From Suica’s version of the team, I changed
Murkrow
‘s
Taunt
to
Quash
, as it was more useful than Taunt most times.
Gholdengo
@ Choice Specs
Ability: Good as Gold
Level: 50
Tera Type:
Steel
EVs: 132 HP / 4 Def / 244 SpA / 4 SpD / 124 Spe
Modest Nature
IVs: 0 Atk
– Make It Rain
– Shadow Ball
– Protect
(originally Trick)
– Thunderbolt
I turned
Gholdengo
faster and made it hold
Choice Specs
, which dealt much more powerful damage. After the tournament, I changed
Trick
to
Protect
, because the Choice Specs were frequently Knocked Off. I must remark that
Make It Rain
is similarly powerful as Water Spout!
Hydreigon
@ Life Orb
Ability: Levitate
Level: 50
Tera Type:
Steel
EVs: 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe
Timid Nature
IVs: 0 Atk
– Dark Pulse
– Flash Cannon
– Draco Meteor
– Protect
I only changed
Hydreigon
‘s Tera Type to
Steel
.
Annihilape
@ Choice Scarf
Ability: Defiant
Level: 50
Tera Type:
Fighting
EVs: 252 HP / 92 Atk / 164 Spe
Adamant Nature
– Final Gambit
– Close Combat
– Shadow Claw
– U-turn
How wise of a Pokémon choice! When I think that an opposing Pokémon is not easy to KO,
Annihilape
‘s
Final Gambit
can be used to turn a 4 vs 4 into a 3 vs 3. When I have the Pokémon advantage, it may even turn into a 2 vs 1, which feels like a checkmate.
I changed one of Annihilape’s moves to
U-turn
, since this move can break Focus Sashes and knock out Meowscarada that do not hold it. Murkrow can then switch in to use Tailwind on the following turn, or even attack if you are in a comfortable position.
Before
Tainan Regionals
, my hotel partner
Liu Jian-ting
(
Sayha
) told me that, if I ignored Dragapult, I could invest more EVs in
Attack
. Being faster than Kilowattrel with the
Choice Scarf
was enough, although I saw a few Talonflame that day! Investing a little more EVs in
Speed
would have been better.
Dragonite
@ Assault Vest
Ability: Inner Focus
Level: 50
Tera Type:
Normal
EVs: 244 HP / 252 Atk / 12 Spe
Adamant Nature
– Extreme Speed
– Earthquake
– Dragon Claw
– Brick Break
Several features were important in the choice of
Dragonite
with respect to Garchomp:
With
Extreme Speed
, it can hit faster than Garchomp.
It can be trained to be stronger than Garchomp, since it does not have the need to invest in
Speed
.
It has a similar base
Attack
than Garchomp.
Armarouge
(M) @ Covert Cloak
Ability: Flash Fire
Level: 50
Tera Type:
Grass
EVs: 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 SpD
Modest Nature
IVs: 0 Atk / 21 Spe
– Expanding Force
– Armor Cannon
– Trick Room
(originally Wide Guard)
– Energy Ball
I lost many games against Torkoal in Trick Room, so I saw the need of a
Trick Room
counter… Eruption was so powerful! That’s where
Armarouge
entered the team.
I chose to run
Expanding Force
without a Psychic Terrain setter, since I only sent out Armarouge when I saw a Trick Room team, and the terrain would usually be activated by the opponent.
How to use the team
Tip
: Tailwind is not that important. At first, try to learn about your opponent, and then choose.
Opponent’s team
Best leads
In the back
Common picks, option #1
+
,
Common picks, option #2
+
,
Talonflame teams
+
,
Trick Room teams
+
,
or
Murkrow mirror teams, option #1
+
,
or
Murkrow mirror teams, option #2
+
or
+
,
or
or
,
or
Tournament run
This was my run at
Tainan Regionals
!

(Tony)
You can watch my
top 4 match
against Chih-chun (starting at 8:15:50) and
finals match
against Yan-rong (starting at 9:00:00) below!
Conclusions
Here you have the
Rental Team
of the version I used in
Tainan
. I hope you enjoy it!
